response.content:
```json
{
  "step1": "Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour two 8-inch round pans. In a large bowl, whisk together 1 ¾ cups flour, 1 ¾ cups sugar, ¾ cup cocoa powder, 1 ½ tsp baking soda, 1 ½ tsp baking powder, and 1 tsp salt thoroughly.",
  "step2": "In a separate medium bowl, combine 2 large eggs, 1 cup milk, ½ cup vegetable oil, and 2 teaspoons vanilla extract. Whisk these wet ingredients until well blended and smooth. Ensure all are at room temperature for optimal mixing and cake texture.",
  "step3": "Gradually add the wet ingredients to the dry, mixing on low speed until just combined. Do not overmix. Stir in 1 cup of hot water or hot coffee last; this creates a very moist batter. The batter will be thin.",
  "step4": "Divide the thin batter evenly between the prepared 8-inch round pans. Place them in the preheated oven. Bake for approximately 30-35 minutes, or until a wooden skewer inserted into the center of the cakes comes out clean.",
  "step5": "Once baked, remove the cakes from the oven. Let them cool in their pans on a wire rack for about 10-15 minutes. Then, carefully invert the cakes onto the wire rack to cool completely. Ensure they are fully cooled before frosting.",
  "step6": "Prepare your favorite chocolate frosting. Once cakes are completely cool, spread a generous layer of frosting between the two layers and over the top and sides of the cake. Decorate as desired. Slice and serve this delicious chocolate cake for 8!"
}
```
